page.title: 07Elburton Vineries
page.content: Elburton Vineries are a very important part of Elburton Village because of the 'Elburton' tomatoes grown there. There are 4.5 acres under glass and they have been there since 1930. Before the vineries were there it was farmland. The Vineries are company owned and the present manager, Mr.Randell, has been there since about 1951. He uses chemical fertilizer for growing his products which include cucumbers as well as tomatoes. The greenhouses are thermostatically controlled at about 70 degrees Fahrenheit. Instead of chemical pesticides he uses predator insects. He has about 12 fulltime & 6 part-time employees. The produce is sold to wholesalers only.
